intro: Meliosma bartlettii, commonly known as the Bartlett's meliosma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Meliosmaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has a short growing season and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
